sim.author: Richard Harrison, Enrique Laso, Alexis Bory, Nikolai V. Chr.

help.title: Grumman F-14

key.name: h
key.desc: Cycle through HSD modes: radar - compas - ECM (RWR)

key.name: Ctrl-v
key.desc: Back to Pilot's View or toggle Pilot's and RIO View.

key.name: Ctrl-v
key.desc: Back to Pilot's View or toggle Pilot's and RIO View.

help.text:
Engine start: ------------- Ensure sufficient fuel and both engines cut off (glare panel), select R Crank from engine control panel (Next to throttles). At 20% RPM push in cut off for R engine. Repeat procedure for Left engine, you can use quickstart from the menu once you have fuel loaded.
Take off: --------- Shore based: MILthrust, flaps as preferred. rotate at 130-160Kts depending on configuration. Do not exceed 10 degrees of pitch. Carrier based: position aircraft onto cat. Kneel nosegear using cockpit switch. Use Shift L to engage launchbar. Set power to MIL, Flaps down. Use Shift C to catapult launch launch. Control pitch after leaving deck, retract gear. Turn to the right or left depending on cat in use.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Autopilot / SAS: ---------------- Autopilot can only be enaged when all SAS channels are active
SAS: Pitch(CTRL-P), Roll (CTRL-K), YAW (CTRL-L) damping controlled by AFCS STAB AUG switches underneath engine controls
Main AFCS mode is Attitude Hold Mode (Ctrl-t). Other Modes need this main mode activated before being selected. Switching off Attitude Mode disables all other modes.
When in Attitude Mode, the autopilot disengages whenever a certain pressure is put on the stick and it reengages when the stick is back in the center position.
Altitude Mode (keyboard CTRL-A): Once in Attitude Mode the AP REF indicator (left of the VDI) illuminates you can switch to altitude by using CTRL-A.
Heading Mode: Once in Attitude Mode, you can select Heading Mode by hitting Ctrl-h. After manoeuvering the aircraft to the desired reference heading, a second selection of CTRL-H will active ground track - which is simulated as following flight plan --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Automatic Power Control (APC) (keyboard "ctrl-s" toggle):
APC regulates engine thrust to maintain thean optimum approach angle of attack for landing. To engage APC, gear must be down, in air, throttles between 98% and 68% rpm (as shown on the panel gauges). Abnormal disengagement will cause the AUTO THROT caution light on the left side of the HUD to illuminate for 10 seconds. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Wing sweep automatic following CADC scehdule. Only possible to sweep wings back outside of schedule. Keys: ">" "<" and the wing sweep control on the throttle quadrant permit manual sweep (middle button to unlock the oversweep guard). '=' to select auto mode.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------- VHF: RIO left console, 3 bands: 30-88 Mhz, 108-174 Mhz, 225-400 Mhz. Modes TR and TR-G set COMM1. Mode DF sets NAV1 direction finder needle in both BDHIs. Only Comm *or* DF. Storing frequencies (up to 20 channels) a- PRESET select the desired chan, b- READ tune the desired frequency, c- LOAD stores the frequency in the previously selected chan.
UHF: Pilot left console 225-400 Mhz. ADF is not enabled on this radio.
TACAN: Pilot left console: ensure mode T/R for DME. R for direction finding only
HUD: Pilot right Front Panel: controls mode and power. multikey :AH followed by (a)ir to air s(on/off) (t)akeoff (l)landing (c)ruise air/(g)round
VDI: Vertical Display Indicator: Pilot right Front Panel: controls mode and power
HSD: Horisontal Situation Display: Pilot right Front Panel: controls mode and power. Key H to toggle modes

key.name: Ctrl-v
key.desc: Select pilot's view (view 0) or toggle between pilot's and RIO's view
Nose wheel steering or Autopilot selected mode

key.name: u
key.desc: Cycle through the 3 refuelling probe switch positions
